ticket.title: Documentation Error on ActiveResource::Errors
ticket.original-body:
Errors add_to_base has an example like so:
my_folder.errors.add_to_base("This folder has been tagged as frozen") my_folder.valid? # => false my_folder.errors.on_base # => ["You can't edit an existing folder", "This folder has been tagged as frozen"]
This is incorrect because valid? clear the errors first. Here is an example:
(rdb:1) @invitation.errors.add_to_base("foo") ["foo"] (rdb:1) @invitation.errors #<ActiveRecord::Errors:0x34bc848 @base=#<Invitation id: 1, validation_level: 40, partner_id: 1, name: "Save The Rainforests", landing_page_template: "MyText", invite_message: "Please save _ the _ __whales__", welcome_page_template: "MyText", additional_signup_fields: nil, created_at: "2008-07-24 15:48:02", updated_at: "2008-07-24 15:48:28">, @errors={"base"=>["foo"]}> (rdb:1) @invitation.valid? true (rdb:1)

Errors add_to_base has an example like so:

my_folder.errors.add_to_base("This folder has been tagged as frozen")

my_folder.valid?

  1. => false

my_folder.errors.on_base

  1. => ["You can't edit an existing folder", "This folder has been tagged as frozen"]

This is incorrect because valid? clear the errors first. Here is an example:

(rdb:1) @invitation.errors.add_to_base("foo")

["foo"]

(rdb:1) @invitation.errors

#, @errors={"base"=>["foo"]}>

(rdb:1) @invitation.valid?

true
